main event: An unidentified object was observed in the vicinity of Toledo, Ohio, on October 17, 1960, identified by radar as a balloon.
interesting points: The object was tracked by three separate radar stations,The object remained in view during an aircraft climb from 25,000 ft to 55,000 ft,The duration of the observation was 1 hour,The Coast Guard attempted to photograph the object which was later recovered,The object was described as round, white, and reflective.
witness description: Air traffic control and military personnel observed the object.
